result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin L. Weed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall report all health care visits to Agent within 48 hours. 
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin L. Weed in court with attorney Jeffrey John Siewert. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea entered on Count 3.  
Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights. 
Court accepts his plea and finds guilty of Count 3. 
On motion of the State, Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed and read in. 
Recommendations by DA Snider and Atty Siewert. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments and fully participate in counseling and treatment recommendations 
- not possess or consume any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia 
- not go upon or remain upon any premises where illegal substances or paraphernalia may be present 
- report all health care visits to Agent within 48 hours 
- report all changes in prescriptions to Agent within 48 hours 
- use only 1 pharmacy 
Advised of appeal rights.
Atty. Siewert asked to reschedule, DA's office no objection.
